children.text: The finished floor level (FFL) of this home appears to be different from the construction documents we were provided.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 2.07 Finished floor levels states that
‘Finished floor levels (FFL) or reduced levels (RL) are defective where they do not comply with specified planning and/or building permit requirements’
‘In other cases, FFL or RL are defective where they depart from the documented RL or FFL by more than 40mm’ .

As lowering the finished height of this home is impossible without demolishing it, the builder should, confirm that the as-built home fits into the local planning requirements and amending the approved plans and building permit, otherwise it should be demolished and re-constructed in accordance with the planning and building permit documents.
